intro: Hydrolea guineensis, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist forests. Hydrolea guineensis is also valued for its ornamental beauty and has traditional uses in some cultures.
